msItem.title: Skånske kirkelov
msItem.incipit:
Dette er den Rett Og Kiercke
Loug, der waar giffuen os
msItem.explicit:
7 Monneder og 12. dage.
Register till. Kiercke Lougen.

supportDesc.support: Paper with watermark. The watermark shows two coats of arms, one on top of the other. The upper one has the arms of the Palatinate and Bavaria, whereas the lower shield shows a crowned man's head with the letters I and S (e.g., fols. 1 and 8, 3 and 6, 9 and 14, 11 and 12.). There is no countermark.

foliation.p: There is later foliation in grey ink in the upper right corner of every folio: 1-14.

collation.p:
The manuscript consists of two quires.
I: fols. 1-8 (1 + 8, 2+7, 3+6, 4+5)
II: fols. 9-14 (9+14, 10+13, 11+12)
collation.catchwords: There is a catchword in the bottom right corner of most pages. Exceptions are 2v, 8r, and 12v.

condition.p: The outer margins are severely damaged (bite marks on the lower outer edges). The damage most certainly postdates the trimming of the leaves but predates the binding.
The lower margin of fol. 9 is also slightly damaged.
The upper outer corner of fol. 11 has been repaired by means of Japanese paper.
A piece of paper was once attached to the outer margin of fol. 1r, but is now mostly removed.
The leaves a slighlty discoloured, mostly around the edges.

layout.p: The manuscript is written in one column with 15 to 17 lines per page and 4 to 6 words per line.
The dimensions of the written area are ca. 130 85-90.

handNote.p: The whole manuscript was written by one unknown scribe. The main text is written in kurrent script, while rubrics are written in chancery.

decoDesc.decoNote: There are penfourished initials in the rubrics and at the beginning of sections executed with black ink (1-2 lines). Most of these initials in the rubrics are decorated with squiggles and fine loops (e.g. 1r, line 1). The beginning of each paragraph is marked by differently decorated initials which partly resemble the initials used for the headings (1-3 lines, e.g. 2v, 3r).

additions.p: Marginal bibliographical note on 8r (written by the scrie) refers to the Jutland law, but is partly illegible due to severe damage to the outer margins.

binding.p: The binding (188 144-147) is made out of handmade grey paper on cardboard. A lable on the upper part of the spine of the manuscript (from Kålund's time) states the shelfmark and the name of the collection. On the lower part of the spine there is the remainder of a white lable that used to show the running number. The covers are slightly dirty and show traces of usage.

On the front board, No 38. B Skaanske Kirche Loug. is written in black ink. Orignally, the letter of the shelfmark was A, but was later crossed out at substituted with a superscript B in lighter brown ink.
The manuscript is stored in one box together with AM 38 a 4to.

accMat.p: Old threads from the binding are stored in the same box as the manuscript.

origin.p: Judging from the language and the subject of the manuscript's text, the manuscript was most certainly written in Denmark. Kålund, KatalogI365 dates it to the 17th century. Narrower dating information provided by Schlyter: Corpus juris Sveo-Gotorum antiqui: Codex juris ScaniciIXxcix, who dates it to the middle of the 17th century.

provenance.p: At some point part of a larger manuscript, later divided into two units: AM 38 a 4to and AM 38 b 4to.
Number 38 in 4towas recorded in Jón Ólafsson's catalogue (1730) as one manuscript, but there is no indication of two copies.

source.p: Catalogued 14 August 2017 by SG and AP.
Checked and expanded 28 August 2017 by BS.
